title.narrative: Tanzania, United Republic of: Targeted country assistance
Tanzanie (la République-Unie de): Aide ciblée aux pays

description.narrative:
L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

Cette activité détaille notre travail sur le Aide ciblée aux pays en Tanzanie (la République-Unie de), grâce à la mise à disposition des données budgétaires et des transactions. Nous fournissons également les documents pertinents qui guident ces activités que sont les formulaires de demande de soutien fournis par le gouvernement de Tanzanie (la République-Unie de) ainsi que les lettres de décisions émises par Gavi, pour progresser. Ces documents décrivent les activités, les objectifs ainsi que les bénéficiaires.

This activity details our work on Targeted country assistance in Tanzania, United Republic of through the provision of budget and transaction data. We also provide the relevant documents that guide these activities, which are the support request proposal(s) provided by the Government of Tanzania, United Republic of, as well as the decision letter(s) issued by Gavi, for progress. These documents describe the activities, the objectives as well as the beneficiaries.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Policy & Regulatory Environment
Zanzibar Immunization Policy document finalized and approved by zMOH by 30th June 2020

target.value:
Conduct Situation analysis including bottleneck assessment
Develop Zanzibar immunization policy to guide the ever expanding immunization program, intorduction of new vaccines and involvement of partners in order to sustain the gains and ensure adequate resource mobilization

Develop Zanzibar immunization policy to guide the ever expanding immunization program, intorduction of new vaccines and involvement of partners in order to sustain the gains and ensure adequate resource mobilization

title.narrative: Copies of Tanzania immunization policy guideline available at different levels of the program and used to inform program implementation.

target.value: Develop country immunization policy to guide the ever expanding immunization program, intorduction of new vaccines and involvement of partners in order to sustain the gains and ensure adequate resource mobilization - TA cnsultant to be embedded with IVD for at least 50% of the time

title.narrative: PATH : Data

IVD and M&E focal persons in each of the region that has transitioned into completely paperless empowered to conduct 2 targeted supportive supervision & mentorship based on performance data and able to address all issues in each of the region

target.value: OBJECTIVE1: Support and build the capacity of the MOHCDGEC ICT, monitoring and evaluation (M&E), and IVD programs in transitioning into completely paperless data collection, processing, and reporting from the PHC to the national levels.

title.narrative: MOH ? ICT team is able to do routine TimR software management (administration, server performance and bug fixing) and customization of current and new features as will be required.

target.value: OBJECTIVE3: Build the capacity of the MOHCDGEC ICT in-house development team in TimR software maintenance and customization.

title.narrative: Four regions of Tanzania mainland transitioned into completely electronic data collection system from health facility to national level

target.value: OBJECTIVE1: Support and build the capacity of the MOHCDGEC ICT, monitoring and evaluation (M&E), and IVD programs in transitioning into completely paperless data collection, processing, and reporting from the PHC to the national levels.

title.narrative: Enhanced TimR software with immunization inequity indicators deployed in prioritized district (s) by MOH

target.value: OBJECTIVE2: Enhance the ability of the TimR system to routinely collect, analyze, and report data related to factors leading to immunization inequities, such as mother?s education, income level, distance from facility or outreach post, and the family?s place of residence.

title.narrative: National Strategy and Guideline for integration of CRVS birth registration and Immunization program developed and disseminated to government and partners to inform scale up and resource mobilization

target.value: OBJECTIVE4: Provide technical capacity and linkages of the TimR system and the country?s CRVS system for improved denominator of the children to be immunized.

title.narrative: Data quality and use guide disseminated to immunization manager across all level of health information system for use

target.value: OBJECTIVE5: Support the MOHCDGEC mainland (M&E and IVD programs) to develop and institutionalize data use accountability on immunization data from the PHC to the national levels for improved coverage and equity.

title.narrative: Publication on contribution of and attribution of TimR in immunization data quality, use and coverage and equity Publication on outcome of CRVS birth registration and Immunization program on denominator and immunization coverage

target.value: OBJECTIVE7: Support the MOHCDGEC in documentation and publication of lessons learned and best practices on existing and emerging issues related to the implementation of the TimR system and data use interventions.

title.narrative:
EIS solution is deployed in 50% of health facilities and district providing immunization service in Zanzibar
Internal evaluation of EIS solution implementation and immunization performance outcome is implemented.

target.value: OBJECTIVE6: Support and build the capacity of the Ministry of Health of Zanzibar in customization and implementation of the EIS for improved coverage and equity.

title.narrative: WHO : Service Delivery
Service delivery approach suitable to reach missed communities identified and endorsed

target.value: Support mapping of Zero dose children and set strategies to vaccinate all eligible children in selected regions-SSA officer to be embedded in IVD for 60% of the time and WHO office 40%
Support Strengthening of routine immunization with focus on increasing uptake of MCV2 vaccine

title.narrative: Service delivery related barriers of missed communities to access immunisation services identified and prioritized

target.value: Support Strengthening of routine immunization with focus on increasing uptake of MCV2 vaccine

target.value: Enhance and Deploy

target.value: Support use of WMS and Complete transition of Systems with WMS systems utilised for managing all vaccines

title.narrative: LTWG meetings convened and demonstrated to be using EIS data regularly in past 6 months

target.value: 6. Support National level in supply chain monitoring through data use (On job training and supporting Logistics TWG sub-committee meetings)

title.narrative: 5 low performing regions achieving quality benchmarks (distribution completeness & updated ledgers) in preceding 6 months;

target.value: 7. Support Effective Vaccine Management Assessments (EVMA) preparation and implementation

title.narrative: Zero Dose Custom Reports implemented

target.value: 1. Designing decision support tools to support reaching of zero dose children. Software developers to enhance VIMS based on requirements from users, IVD and partners in efforts to reach zero dose children

title.narrative: Data improvement field activity implemented in 5 low performing Regions

target.value: 3. Support EIS data quality improvement at national and subnational levels. JSI staff participation and co-facilitation in Immunization performance review session at subnational levels, districts immunization performance evaluation meetings (EPI parliament), Immunization Technical Working Group (TWG) meetings, ICC and Annual Immunization Evaluation meeting as planned in IVD annual plan

title.narrative: Documentation of lessons learnt from efforts to improve consistency of data in VIMS, RTM, DHIS2 and TImR in 5 low performing regions

target.value: 2. Support IVD in monitoring and troubleshooting EIS integration

title.narrative: Increase in reporting through RTM and TImR in 5 low performing regions

target.value: 4. Monitoring and Maintenance visits to support RTM and TImR use in low performing regions

title.narrative: 5 low performing regions trained in triangulating stock, CCE and performance data to prepare monthly needs

target.value: 5. Capacity building for subnational levels in forecasting and triangulating stock and vaccination data in VIMS (by contributing to Mid-Level Manager training, New comers training, CCE Technician training and development of immunization mentorship packages)

title.narrative: 100% of Data synchronized between TImR -VIMS- DHIS2 by end of TCA project

target.value: Strengthen the integration of data systems by end of TCA project

title.narrative: UNICEF
At least one visit conducted to support EPI in Zanzibar

Medium-term costed strategic plan for immunisation (National Immunisation Strategy) developed by MOH/EPI and integrated with national health strategy (country-led, with a capacity building component)

target.value: Support Zanzibar to develop 2021-2025 National Immunization Strategy (NIS)

title.narrative: Immunisation-related planning priorities and resource needs reflected in the national health plan and budget/medium-term expenditure frameworks

target.value: Support Zanzibar to develop 2021-2025 National Immunization Strategy (NIS)

title.narrative: UNICEF : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
At least two (2) more regions make transition to paperless following implementation of EIS by November 2022
